alert.note: Alert for Custer; Dewey (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 11 at 2:17AM CDT until July 11 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN WASHITA...NORTHWESTERN CADDO...EASTERN CUSTER... SOUTHWESTERN BLAINE AND SOUTHEASTERN DEWEY COUNTIES... At 217 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Fay to near Weatherford to 3 miles south of Corn, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Weatherford, Clinton, Watonga, Cordell, Thomas, Hydro, Arapaho, Corn, Custer City, Bessie, Colony, and Fay. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
